channel.title: RNZ Covid-19 Headlines
channel.description: The Latest Covid-19 headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Live Covid-19 updates for 17 September - everything you need to know
item.description: Four new locations of interest have been identified by the Ministry of Health, three in the Tauranga area.

item.title: School holiday dates to remain unchanged - Minister Hipkins
item.description: School holiday dates in Auckland will not be changed because of the lockdown, Education Minister Chris Hipkins has announced.

item.title: Fox Glacier businesses consider whether to close after latest lockdown
item.description: Fox Glacier businesses are holding out hope for a school holiday boost after a long and difficult winter.

item.title: Peer pressure trumps Bloomfield as level 2 teens reject masks at school
item.description: It seems the influence of the Director-General of Health Ashley Bloomfield is no match for peer pressure, with most teens in alert level 2 not bothering to wear face masks in class.

item.title: Truck driver's infection picked up in Covid-19 surveillance testing - Henare
item.description: Locations of interest in the Tauranga area have been identified by the Ministry of Health after an Auckland truck driver tested positive for Covid-19.

item.title: Air NZ to use $85m more of government loan
item.description: Air New Zealand will draw down further on its loan from the government as it manages the effects of latest lockdown.

item.title: Covid-19 debate - When should New Zealand open up its borders?
item.description: Were the elimination strategy and lockdowns the best options for New Zealand to control Covid-19 and going forward what is the best way to deal with the Delta variant?

item.title: Waitematā DHB senior medical staff pitch in to help vaccinate
item.description: An anaesthetist who is volunteering as a Covid-19 vaccinator in his level 4 downtime says he is loving being part of the drive to immunise Auckland.

item.title: Teddy bears put on a daily show for Auckland suburb
item.description: Teddy bear displays on an Auckland family's front yard have become something to admire from afar for people out on their lockdown trot around the block.

item.title: Covid-19 wrap: What happened on 16 September
item.description: A truck driver who has travelled across the Auckland border tests positive for Covid-19, the first vaccination buses go on the road and gathering limits may increase under level 2 if Auckland moves down a level.

item.title: Māori-led mobile vaccine clinic in Wellington helps to curb vaccine hesitancy
item.description: A Māori-led mobile vaccine clinic that focuses on going to emergency and transitional housing is being used in Te Whanganui-a-Tara to help curb vaccine hesitation in the community.

item.title: Covid-19 in NZ in numbers
item.description: Here is all the information you need to stay up to date with the latest Covid-19 case numbers, testing and vaccination data in New Zealand.

item.title: Wellington hotel to no longer be used as MIQ facility
item.description: The Bay Plaza Hotel will no longer be used as a managed isolation facility from the end of the year.

item.title: Covid-19 updates for 16 September - as it happened
item.description: The government wants 80 percent of Aucklanders to have had at least one dose of the Covid-19 vaccine within the week. See how the rest of the day's Covid-19 news unfolded with RNZ's live blog.

item.title: Covid-19: Truck driver who crossed border tests positive
item.description: One of today's new community cases was a truck driver who has travelled across the Auckland border, Director-General of Health Ashley Bloomfield has revealed today.

item.title: Covid-19 update: 13 new cases in the community
item.description: There are 13 new cases of Covid-19 in the community, all in Auckland, the Health Ministry has announced today.

item.title: Covid-19 briefing: Gathering limits could increase under level two
item.description: If Auckland does move down an alert level next week, the rest of the country will also see some easing of the alert level 2 rules, according to the prime minister. Watch the latest government update here.

item.title: Auckland entrepreneur and employee cleared after flying to Wānaka on chartered plane
item.description: Police are satisfied an Auckland entrepreneur and his employee who flew to Wānaka on a chartered plane were permitted to do so.

item.title: Air NZ offered free flight change from Auckland to Hamilton departure
item.description: A man is surprised Air New Zealand suggested travelling out of lockdown in Auckland to Hamilton to take advantage of the offer of a free-of-charge flight change.

item.title: Covid-19 lockdown: Auckland businesses question how 'essential' is defined
item.description: The issue of which businesses are and aren't essential during Auckland's level 4 lockdown has some businesses frustrated and disheartened as their finances continue to dwindle.

item.title: Health experts say talk of vaccination targets unhelpful
item.description: Countries around the world are starting to imagine a future living with Covid-19 as vaccination benchmarks are reached.

item.title: Sports teams, business people and entertainers using MIQ spots
item.description: The Bangladesh cricket team will have been able to visit New Zealand twice this year, before many New Zealanders abroad have been able to return at all.

item.title: Reopened MIQ bookings welcomed but 'still the same number of needles in the haystack'
item.description: Lifting the pause on MIQ places is a good start but the number of spots hasn't changed and the criteria for emergency allocations is still too strict for some, the Grounded Kiwis group says.

item.title: Buses a 'self-determined' vaccination initiative for socially excluded: Māori health advocates
item.description: Māori health leaders in Auckland say today's roll-out of buses and mobile clinics are part of a long-overdue vaccination outreach programme tailored to the needs of their communities.

item.title: Middlemore Hospital testing every ward patient for Covid-19
item.description: Middlemore Hospital has begun testing new patients for Covid-19 after five patients have turned up unaware they had the virus until tested there.

item.title: Covid-19: Weekly tests for essential workers crossing Auckland border come in tomorrow
item.description: Essential workers crossing Auckland's level 4 border will not have to show they have tested negative for Covid-19, only that they have had the test.

item.title: Covid-19 wrap: what happened on 15 September
item.description: MIQ vouchers will soon be available, a vaccination bus is planned to go through South Auckland neighbourhoods, and there's a call for Covid-19 drugs to be funded.

item.title: Pensioners stuck in Australia ask for 'Jacinda's kindness'
item.description: An unknown number of New Zealand Superannuitants risk having their pension payments suspended after getting stuck in Australia when the trans-Tasman bubble burst and MIQ was frozen.

item.title: Remote learning across Auckland schools: 'It's pretty normal'
item.description: Thousands of school-aged Auckland children are logging on for school every day with the city now into its fifth week of level 4 lockdown.

item.title: NSW records 1351 Covid-19 cases and 12 deaths
item.description: NSW recorded 1351 new locally acquired Covid-19 infections in the 24 hours to 8pm yesterday.

item.title: 'Decimated': Franz Josef tourism businesses suffer as borders stay closed
item.description: Franz Josef business owners say they are struggling to keep their heads above water after losing Aucklanders and international visitors.

item.title: Voucher website passes $250,000 in transactions supporting small business
item.description: The not-for-profit voucher website SOS Business is seeing a surge in demand from people wanting to support small businesses during lockdown.

item.title: Covid-19: All sectors urged to get vaccinated
item.description: Businesses worried about ongoing lockdowns are being encouraged to get their staff vaccinated to prevent further lockdowns.

item.title: NSW Covid-19 update: 12 deaths, 1259 new community cases and a vaccine milestone
item.description: There were 12 deaths and 1259 new community infections of Covid-19 in NSW, the premier has announced.

item.title: Covid-19: Mt Ruapehu businesses missing Auckland visitors
item.description: Businesses around Mt Ruapehu are missing their Auckland visitors with the supercity still at Covid-19 alert level 4.

item.title: Retailers using loans to keep Wellington businesses afloat
item.description: It's a decidedly mixed bag for Wellington's inner-city businesses getting used to the new normal of Delta level 2.

item.title: How a vaccine argument drove a wedge through our family
item.description: First person experience - When Lucy McKenzie's* sister first told her vaccines caused autism, she scoffed. But when Covid-19 hit, the anti-vax arguments drove a wedge down the middle of her family.

item.title: Bloomfield warns against social media Covid-19 misinformation
item.description: The Director-General of Health has hit back at false social media claims on vaccines, natural immunity and Ivermectin.

item.title: Live Covid-19 updates for 15 September - everything you need to know
item.description: A man who had just bought a new boat is the latest person to attempt to get around the Auckland border rules. See how the day's Covid-19 news devloped with RNZ's blog.

item.title: Covid-19 update: 14 new community cases announced
item.description: There have been 14 new community cases of Covid-19 reported today, all epidemiologically linked to previous cases, the Ministry of Health has revealed.

item.title: Government urged to buy 'game changer' Covid-19 drug treatment
item.description: The government is being asked to quickly approve and buy a type of drug that can fire up the immune system of people already sick from Covid-19, as well as reduce deaths and time spent in hospital.

item.title: NZ's MIQ booking system to resume on Monday
item.description: New Zealand's MIQ booking system - which has been paused due to the Delta outbreak - will resume on Monday, Covid-19 Response Minister Chris Hipkins has confirmed. Watch the latest government briefing here.

item.title: Teen's death investigated but no evidence of link to vaccine - Chief Coroner
item.description: The chief coroner says there is no evidence an Auckland teenager's death is linked to their Covid-19 vaccination.

item.title: School holiday date change too disruptive - principals
item.description: A late change to school holidays would see "a few stressed out teachers hitting the wall" and the same for students, an Auckland secondary principals' leader says.

item.title: Students stuck in Auckland say they're missing out
item.description: University students in Auckland have mixed feelings about their lockdown learning.

item.title: Law Society to look into rule flouting by lawyer who fled to Wānaka
item.description: The president of the law society has expressed disappointment a lawyer is accused of flouting the Auckland lockdown rules to travel to a holiday home in Wānaka.

item.title: Students trapped in Auckland fear falling behind in studies
item.description: University students who are stuck in lockdown in Auckland say they are falling behind learning remotely while most of their peers are able to attend classes physically.

item.title: Pet food shortages causing angst for fussy felines
item.description: It's not just toilet paper and flour - pet food shortages have exacerbated over New Zealand's Covid-19 delta outbreak, clearing out supermarket shelves faster than normal.

item.title: Couple who flouted Auckland lockdown to travel to Wānaka named
item.description: The couple who flew to Wānaka, breaking Auckland's level 4 lockdown restrictions can be named as William Willis and Hannah Rawnsley.

item.title: Little clarifies plan for buses and mobile clinics to boost vaccination rates
item.description: Health Minister Andrew Little has clarified buses will tomorrow start vaccinating the people of South Auckland in their own neighbourhoods in a bid to boost vaccination numbers.

item.title: Calls for Govt to offer additional financial, mental health support to businesses
item.description: Hospitality New Zealand says even under alert level 2 it is not financially viable for some businesses to open their doors because of the new restrictions to adapt to Delta.

item.title: Elimination and Delta: Statements from 10 experts and leaders
item.description: Talking points - With consensus on eliminating Covid-19 Delta showing signs of wavering this week, RNZ asked politicians, scientists and officials if it's time to double down or change tack.

item.title: Woman refusing mask at supermarket returns with men, assaults guard - police
item.description: Two people have been arrested and charged after a security guard at Takanini Pak'nSave was assaulted.

item.title: Why mask wearing will become a part of normal life
item.description: The Detail - Mask-wearing has become part of our lives as New Zealand tackles the Delta variant - and may be here to stay for the foreseeable future.

item.title: PM Jacinda Ardern on Covid-19 alert levels: Good testing rates will give 'extra reassurance'
item.description: Moving Auckland out of level 4 lockdown won't require having zero 'mystery' Covid-19 cases, Jacinda Ardern says.

item.title: NSW records 1,127 Covid-19 cases, two deaths
item.description: NSW has recorded 1,127 new locally acquired infections and two deaths in the 24 hours to 8pm yesterday.

item.title: England to offer Covid-19 vaccine to 12 to 15-year-olds
item.description: The children will be offered a Covid-19 vaccine after top medical advisers said it would help limit disruption to their education.

item.title: Wānaka businesses struggle without Auckland dollar
item.description: The school holidays are just around the corner but some parts of the country are expecting to miss out on an influx of visitors from Auckland.

item.title: Businesses in lockdown urge government to consider loans and lease schemes
item.description: The government should consider financial support schemes like interest-free loans or some kind of commercial lease support, business network leaders say.

item.title: South Auckland housing development hit by Covid-19 restrictions
item.description: The uncertainty caused by the Covid-19 outbreak is taking a toll on building projects.
